sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Samsung and Anghami promote foldable Galaxy phones for creative work
feed.summary: Samsung MENA and Anghami have launched 'I Am the Scene', an initiative to support emerging artists in the Middle East region. The campaign highlights Samsung's latest foldable devices, the Galaxy Z Fold7 and Galaxy Z Flip7, as creative studios for artists. Influential MENA artists Sultan Al Murshed and Marilyne Naaman are leading workshops on using Galaxy devices for creative work as part of this initiative.

feed.title: Samsung and Anghami partner to empower MENA’s rising artists with 'I Am The Scene' campaign
feed.summary: Samsung Electronics MENA and Anghami have launched 'I Am the Scene,' a regional initiative to support emerging artists in the Middle East by bridging foldable Galaxy innovation with musical artistry. The campaign centers on Samsung's latest foldable devices, the Galaxy Z Fold7 and Galaxy Z Flip7, which enable artists to create music with mobile-led tools and AI features. Influential MENA artists Sultan Al Murshed and Marilyne Naaman are leading workshops, demonstrating how Galaxy devices can elevate the creative process from composing to editing.

feed.title: Samsung and Anghami partner to empower MENA’s rising artists with 'I Am The Scene' campaign
feed.summary: Samsung Electronics MENA and Anghami have launched 'I Am the Scene', a regional initiative to support emerging artists in the Middle East through mobile-led music creation using Samsung's foldable Galaxy devices. The campaign includes workshops led by influential artists Sultan Al Murshed and Marilyne Naaman, demonstrating how Galaxy devices can be used throughout the creative process. This collaboration aims to provide young artists with tools to express themselves and highlight new voices from Arab youth communities.

feed.title: Anghami Completes OSN Convertible Note Conversion
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. (ANGH) has converted its senior unsecured convertible notes held by OSN Streaming Limited into 2,376,171 ordinary shares, eliminating outstanding debt and potentially strengthening its equity structure. This strategic financial move occurred on December 15, 2025. ANGH currently has a Hold rating with a $2.50 price target from the most recent analyst, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, also rates ANGH as Neutral, citing revenue growth offset by losses and negative cash flows.

feed.title: OSN+ and Anghami appoint Teresa Antas Rio as VP of Marketing
feed.summary: OSN Group has appointed Teresa Antas Rio as its new Vice President of Marketing, overseeing marketing, creative direction, and communications for OSN+ and Anghami. This strategic move aims to strengthen brand identity and audience engagement across the region, leveraging Rio's global experience in media and entertainment. Her role will focus on enhancing curated storytelling for OSN+ and positioning Anghami as a key hub for regional music culture.

feed.title: OSN+ and Anghami appoint Teresa Antas Rio as VP – Marketing
feed.summary: OSN Group has appointed Teresa Antas Rio as Vice President of Marketing for OSN+ and Anghami, its entertainment portfolio. Rio, with a background in media, entertainment, and consumer brands, will lead marketing, creative, and communications strategy, aiming to transform how audiences experience entertainment through connection, joy, and cultural relevance. Her previous roles include Brand Director at NEOM Media and Marketing Director at The Walt Disney Company.

feed.title: Anghami Inc. Plans Reverse Stock Split to Meet Nasdaq Compliance
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. announced plans for a 1-for-10 reverse stock split to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement of $1.00 per share. An extraordinary general meeting is scheduled for July 22, 2025, to vote on this proposal, with the majority shareholder, OSN+, expected to vote in favor. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates ANGH as Underperform due to financial performance, ongoing losses, and a bearish trend.

feed.title: PRESSR: Anghami and Huawei celebrate five years of collaboration shaping a connected entertainment ecosystem across MENA
feed.summary: Anghami and Huawei are celebrating five years of collaboration that has transformed how audiences across the MENA region experience music. Their partnership has expanded Anghami's presence across Huawei's ecosystem, from smartphones and wearables to connected cars, including the launch of HarmonyOS smartwatch apps and integration into Huawei’s HMS for Car platform. This strategic alliance continues to deliver seamless and culturally relevant music experiences to millions of users.

feed.title: Elie Habib
feed.summary: Elie Habib is the co-founder and CTO of Anghami, a Middle Eastern music streaming service launched in 2011. Under his leadership, Anghami went public on NASDAQ in March 2021 through a merger with Vistas Media Acquisition Company Inc., achieving a combined valuation of approximately $220 million. The company has since secured significant investments and engaged in mergers, expanding its services and user base in the MENA region.

feed.title: Anghami Inc. Announces OSN Convertible Note Conversion
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. announced that OSN Streaming Limited will convert $55 million in senior unsecured convertible notes, plus approximately $4.4 million in PIK interest, into 2,376,171 ordinary shares. This conversion could significantly impact Anghami’s equity structure and market position. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, indicates a Neutral outlook for ANGH stock due to ongoing losses, negative cash flows despite revenue growth, bearish technical trends, and a lack of profitability.

feed.title: Anghami Inc. Transfers Listing to Nasdaq Capital Market
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. (ANGH) has received approval to transfer its securities listing from the Nasdaq Global Market to the Nasdaq Capital Market, effective February 21, 2025. This move grants Anghami an extension until August 18, 2025, to meet Nasdaq's $1 bid price requirement. The company will continue to trade under its existing symbols.

feed.title: Anghami Inc. Proposes Reverse Stock Split to Maintain Nasdaq Compliance
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. plans a 1-for-10 reverse stock split to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement and ensure continued listing. The proposal is expected to be approved as the majority shareholder, OSN+, plans to vote in favor. Despite revenue growth, the company faces financial challenges, persistent losses, and negative cash flows, leading TipRanks' AI Analyst Spark to rate ANGH as Neutral.

feed.title: Can Anghami Inc. Equity Warrant stock surprise with earnings upside - Market Risk Summary & Daily Profit Focused Stock Screening - newser.com
feed.summary: The requested page for "Can Anghami Inc. Equity Warrant stock surprise with earnings upside" does not exist on Newser. The website provides navigational links to various news sections instead of the article's content.

feed.title: OSN Group appoints Current Global MENAT as regional PR partner
feed.summary: OSN Group has selected Current Global MENAT as its exclusive public relations agency to manage external communications for OSN+, OSNtv, Anghami, and its B2B offerings. Current Global MENAT aims to amplify OSN Group's growing content portfolio and strategic partnerships through earned media engagement and creative campaigns. This partnership will support OSN Group in its mission to be the largest and most comprehensive entertainment streaming service in the Middle East.

feed.title: Anghami plans reverse stock split to avoid delisting
feed.summary: Anghami, the first Arab tech startup to list on Nasdaq, plans a 1-for-10 reverse stock split to avoid delisting, despite posting its inaugural profit in late 2024. The move, approved by shareholders, is intended to raise the share price above Nasdaq's $1 minimum bid requirement, as its shares closed at $0.0117. Although the company reported a $2.7 million profit in the second half of 2024 and narrowed its annual net loss, it faces challenges including reliance on licensed music and potential impacts from AI-generated content.

feed.title: Anghami Announces 1-for-10 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The split will take effect on August 4, 2025, with shares trading under the existing symbol "ANGH." This action will not dilute shareholders and aims to maintain the company's listing on the Nasdaq Capital Market.

feed.title: Anghami to implement 1-for-10 reverse stock split to meet Nasdaq requirements
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split of its ordinary shares to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The stock is expected to trade on a split-adjusted basis starting August 4, 2025, and shareholders will receive cash in lieu of fractional shares. Despite financial challenges, including a current ratio of 0.6, the company continues its corporate strategy to maintain its listing.

feed.title: Anghami stock falls after announcing 1-for-10 reverse split
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. (NASDAQ: ANGH) experienced a 9.4% stock drop following its announcement of a 1-for-10 reverse stock split. This action, approved by shareholders, aims to regain compliance with Nasdaq Capital Market's minimum bid price requirement. The reverse split will consolidate shares and proportionately adjust convertible securities and warrants, with no dilutive effect on shareholders.

feed.title: Anghami Shares Drop Following Announcement of 1-for-10 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Anghami shares experienced a significant drop following the announcement of a 1-for-10 reverse stock split. This move by the company aims to address a decline in its stock price and potentially boost its per-share value. The market's reaction suggests investor concern regarding the implications of this action.

feed.title: Anghami Announces Major 1-for-10 Reverse Split: What This Means for Your Shares
feed.summary: Anghami (NASDAQ: ANGH) has announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement, effective August 4, 2025. This move will combine every ten existing shares into one new share, with fractional shares receiving cash payments. The company assures shareholders that the split is not dilutive and the relative proportion of shares held will remain unchanged.

feed.title: TikTok integrates another streaming service into Add to Music App feature, with Anghami partnership
feed.summary: TikTok has partnered with Anghami, a leading streaming service in the Middle East and North Africa, to integrate it into its 'Add to Music App' feature. This allows users in the MENA region to directly save tracks discovered on TikTok to their Anghami music libraries. The collaboration follows the feature's successful global rollout in 2024, which has generated over a billion track saves, and coincides with Believe's expansion of Artist Services in the region and Nancy Ajram's new album release.

feed.title: Anghami Full Year 2024 Earnings: US$1.10 loss per share (vs US$0.60 loss in FY 2023)
feed.summary: Anghami (NASDAQ: ANGH) reported a significant widening of its net loss for fiscal year 2024, reaching US$63.6 million, a 302% increase from FY 2023. The company's loss per share deteriorated to US$1.10 from US$0.60 in the previous year. Despite the increased losses, revenue saw a substantial increase of 89% to US$78.1 million.

feed.title: Warner Bros. invests $57 million in OSN+ for minority stake
feed.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has invested $57 million in OSN+, a UAE-based entertainment streaming platform, for approximately 30% equity. This deal aims to capture the fast-growing Middle Eastern entertainment market by focusing on locally produced content and exploring synergies between the companies. The investment builds on existing licensing agreements between OSN and Warner Bros.-owned entities like HBO.

feed.title: Anghami Files 2023 Annual Report and Announces 2024 Q1 Results, Highlighting 18% Growth in Subscribers and Significant Margin Improvement
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. announced its 2023 annual report filing and preliminary Q1 2024 results, showcasing an 18% growth in premium subscribers to 1.87 million and an 8% increase in total revenues. The company also reported a significant improvement in gross margin from 20% to 26% and a reduction in operating loss, driven by strategic optimizations and the recent OSN+ transaction. Despite challenges like currency devaluation and regional conflicts in 2023, Anghami is positioned for strong performance in 2024.

feed.title: Top 10 Tech Companies to Work for in Lebanon in 2024
feed.summary: Lebanon's tech sector is experiencing a significant boom, with an 8.7% annual growth rate projected from 2022 to 2027. This article identifies the top 10 tech companies to work for in Lebanon in 2024, including Anghami, Murex, CME Offshore, FOO, and Diwanee. These companies are highlighted for their supportive cultures, career growth opportunities, and innovative environments, making them attractive for tech professionals.

feed.title: ESMAA and Anghami Settle Legal Dispute, New Licensing In Place
feed.summary: ESMAA, an Abu Dhabi-based rights management entity, and Anghami, a leading music streaming platform in MENA, have settled their legal dispute and announced a new music licensing agreement. This agreement, based on global practices, aims to ensure fair compensation for songwriters, composers, and publishers while supporting the music ecosystem in the MENA region. The partnership represents a significant step for international independent music publishers and a domestic streaming service.

feed.title: Abu Dhabi’s ESMAA and Anghami settle legal dispute and strike licensing agreement
feed.summary: Abu Dhabi-based ESMAA and MENA-focused streaming service Anghami have settled a legal dispute and entered into a music licensing agreement. This deal, described as the first of its kind for international independent music publishers and a domestic streaming service in the MENA region, resolves a December 2022 lawsuit against Anghami for allegedly streaming unlicensed songs. The agreement will license a significant portion of the independent music publishing community's repertoire through ESMAA.

feed.title: Anghami and OSN+ Successfully Complete Milestone Transaction, Creating an Entertainment Powerhouse
feed.summary: Anghami and OSN+ have successfully completed a milestone transaction, with OSN Group acquiring a 55.45% majority stake in Anghami at $3.69 per share. This deal creates an entertainment powerhouse with over 120 million registered users, 2.5 million paid subscribers, and close to $100 million in revenue, combining OSN+'s premium video content with Anghami's vast music and podcast catalog. Elie Habib will lead the combined entity as Anghami's new CEO.

feed.title: Saudi Arabian media giant MBC quietly bought a 14% stake in Anghami
feed.summary: Saudi Arabian media giant MBC Group has acquired a 13.7% stake in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) music streaming service Anghami. The acquisition, valued at approximately $4.074 million based on Anghami's share price on March 19, caused Anghami's stock to jump 59% after the news became public. This strategic investment aims to expand MBC's presence in the streaming market and leverage Anghami's user base, while providing Anghami with access to MBC's distribution network and content creation expertise.

feed.title: Anghami Shares Jump 59% After Saudi Media Company MBC Group Takes 14% Stake
feed.summary: Shares of Abu Dhabi-based music streaming company Anghami soared 59% after an SEC filing revealed that Saudi media company MBC Group has acquired a 13.7% stake. This substantial investment is seen as a positive sign for Anghami's financial and promotional resources, especially as the company has faced challenges including trading below the Nasdaq's $1 threshold. The investment follows previous strategic funding rounds and comes after Anghami's shares had fallen significantly since its 2022 debut.

feed.title: Anghami and Rotana Renew Partnership and Expand Scope of Collaborations
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. and Rotana Music have renewed and expanded their strategic partnership for another three years, focusing on content and concert collaborations. This agreement grants Anghami access to Rotana's extensive Arabic music catalog and will include joint live concerts and artist collaborations across the MENA region. The partnership aims to enhance the Arabic music landscape and offer unique experiences to artists and fans.

feed.title: Anghami Merges With Dubai-Based Netflix Rival OSN+ to ‘Reinvent Entertainment in the Arab World’
feed.summary: Dubai-based streaming platform OSN+ has acquired a majority stake in Nasdaq-listed music streaming service Anghami in a deal valued at up to $50 million, creating a powerful media partnership in the MENA region. The merger aims to combine Anghami's music catalog and tech with OSN+'s video content to offer a unique, AI-driven streaming experience, targeting over 2.5 million paying subscribers and $100 million in revenue. Anghami's co-founder Elie Habib will lead the combined streaming companies, with the transaction expected to finalize in Q1 2024.

feed.title: Anghami see huge growth in 2023
feed.summary: Anghami, the leading music streaming service in the Middle East and Africa, reported significant growth in 2023, with a 17% increase in subscribers and an 8% rise in adjusted revenue for the first nine months. Key drivers include direct subscriptions, the launch of Anghami Gold, enhanced partnerships, and robust advertising revenue growth of 28% year-on-year for Q3. The company also improved efficiency by optimizing backend costs, refining marketing, and reducing its workforce by 15%.

feed.title: Dalia Mubarak takes over Riyadh at Anghami Lab
feed.summary: Anghami Inc. and Warner Music MENA celebrated Saudi artist Dalia Mubarak's album "11:11" with an event at Anghami Lab in Riyadh. The celebration, purposefully held on November 11th, featured the premiere of her music video ‘Sodfa’ and a takeover of Riyadh Boulevard Square screens. Dalia Mubarak is the first artist to host an album celebration exclusively at Anghami Lab, highlighting her significant milestone and the widespread support for her musical journey.

feed.title: OSN+ and Anghami Sign Landmark Transaction Set to Transform MENA Entertainment
feed.summary: OSN+ and Anghami Inc. have announced a landmark transaction to combine their businesses, creating the first regional platform offering both video and music streaming services in MENA. The deal involves an investment of up to $50 million from OSN Group into Anghami at a valuation of $3.65 per share, aiming to create one of the region's largest streaming platforms with over 120 million registered users and 2.5+ million subscribers. This combination will leverage Anghami's tech and music catalogue with OSN+'s premium video content to deliver a seamless and personalized digital streaming experience.

feed.title: Anghami could be delisted from the Nasdaq this week (or in the very near future)
feed.summary: MENA-focused music streaming service Anghami is facing potential delisting from The Nasdaq Global Market due to non-compliance with the minimum market value requirement of $50 million. The company's market cap is currently $20.91 million, significantly down from its $220 million valuation 18 months ago. Anghami intends to request a hearing to seek continued listing or a transfer to The Nasdaq Capital Market, while also addressing a previous warning about its sub-$1 share price.

feed.title: Anghami issued with Nasdaq warning over share price
feed.summary: Music streaming service Anghami has received a warning from Nasdaq that its stock price is too low, violating listing rules that require a minimum share price of $1. The company has 180 days to regain compliance, with options including a reverse share split, as its share price has fallen significantly since its 2022 Nasdaq debut. Despite recent revenue growth and cost-cutting measures, Anghami's market capitalization is now around $22.2 million, a tenth of its valuation at the time of its SPAC merger.

feed.title: Saudi Arabia’s SRMG Makes Strategic Investment in Anghami, Spotify’s MENA Region Rival
feed.summary: SRMG Ventures, the venture capital arm of Saudi Research and Media Group, has strategically invested $5 million in Anghami, a music and entertainment streamer often called the Arab world's rival to Spotify. This investment is coupled with SRMG providing its media reach and content library to Anghami, aiming to boost its market share in the rapidly growing MENA music streaming sector. The partnership aligns with SRMG's broader strategy, including its recent collaboration with Billboard to launch Billboard Arabia, to promote Arab music talent and develop the regional media ecosystem.

feed.title: Genie's overseas sales of music sources surge with K-pop boom
feed.summary: Genie Music Corp., a music content distributor for KT Corp., has seen a significant surge in its overseas music source sales, with an average 62% annual increase from 2018 to 2022, driven by the global popularity of K-pop. The company's revenue from overseas music sources grew from 3.5 billion won in 2018 to 24.1 billion won in 2021, and they have expanded their global network by striking deals with major platforms like Tidal, Anghami, Tencent Music, Huawei Music, and TikTok.
feed.source: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
feed.source_domain: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
